bug.author: SalChem
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
I have multiple select boxes but changing one affects the others. It selects the same index on the other select boxes lists. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
box1 = st.selectbox("", [1, 2, 3]) box2 = st.selectbox("", [4,5,6]) selecting 3rd index on first box changes the second box as well!

comments.comment:
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/SalChem>@SalChem</denchmark-link>
The first argument to Selectbox is a label which uniquely identifies the widget in the report. Initialize your widgets with different labels and they should work. box1 = st.selectbox("label1", [1, 2, 3]) box2 = st.selectbox("label2", [4,5,6])

Thank you <denchmark-link:https://github.com/jrhone>@jrhone</denchmark-link> . That makes sense. However, the label is printed out! so what if you don't want it printed out?! That's why I hadn't put anything as label.

Since version 0.49.0 you can now pass in a key argument to disambiguate when labels aren't unique: <denchmark-code>box1 = st.selectbox("", [1, 2, 3], key="box1") box2 = st.selectbox("", [4,5,6], key="box2") </denchmark-code>
I just added a documentation improvement request here: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues/519>#519</denchmark-link>
